'''Frank Buytendijk''' ([[The Hague]], 1969) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] author of management books. He studied business and information technology at the [[Hogeschool Utrecht]] (University of Applied Sciences Utrecht), was a consultant at various firms in his home country, a research analyst and held executive positions in various large, medium and small software companies. He has a background in [[business intelligence]], [[corporate performance management]] and [[business process management]]. Buytendijk is also a visiting fellow at [[Cranfield University]] School of Management.<ref>[http://www.som.cranfield.ac.uk/som/p14021/People/Faculty/Visiting-Fellows/Frank-Buytendijk Visiting Fellow Biography on Cranfield University website]</ref> In 2012, he was appointed fellow at The Data Warehousing Institute (TDWI).<ref>[http://www.tdwi.eu/tdwi-germany-ev/tdwi-fellow Fellow at TDWI]</ref> Currently, Frank is a Research vice president at analyst firm [[Gartner]],<ref>[http://www.gartner.com/AnalystBiography?authorId=17247 Gartner analyst profile]</ref> where he served before as well, between 2001 and 2006.
He wrote five books,<ref>[http://www.worldcat.org/search?qt=worldcat_org_all&q=frank+buytendijk Worldcat author record]</ref> related to [[strategy]], [[organizational behavior]] and [[performance management]]. A common theme throughout these books is the application of [[stakeholder theory]] in business.
According to [http://www.managementboek.nl/boek/9789014065748/balanced-scorecard-frank-buytendijk managementboek.nl], his first book, on [[balanced scorecard]]s,<ref>Balanced Scorecard: Van Meten Naar Managen (Dutch), Buytendijk, F.A. & Brinkhuis-Slaghuis, J., 2000, Kluwer, ISBN 9014065744</ref> briefly reached the #1 sales position for management books in the Netherlands, and remained in the top 100 for 890 days.<ref>[http://www.managementboek.nl/boek/9789014065748/balanced-scorecard-frank-buytendijk #1 sales position on managementboek.nl]</ref> The second book, on data warehouses, quickly followed.<ref>Datawarehouses: Bron van Kennis voor Marketing en Sales (Dutch), Buytendijk, F.A. & Groot, C. de, 2000, Kluwer, ISBN 9014068204</ref> This was a more technology-oriented book. Both the first and second book were in Dutch.
Buytendijk's third book, "Performance Leadership" was published by [[McGraw-Hill]] and discussed the relationship between performance management and organizational behavior.<ref>Performance Leadership, Buytendijk, F.A., 2008, McGraw-Hill, ISBN 0071599649</ref> The book has its roots in [[behavioral economics]]. "Dealing with Dilemmas", published by [[John Wiley & Sons]] followed in 2010.<ref>Dealing with Dilemmas, Buytendijk, F.A., 2010, Wiley & Sons, ISBN 0470630310</ref> It argues, following [[Henry Mintzberg]], that strategy is full of [[dilemma]]s that require a different approach than traditional [[analysis]], namely the opposite, [[synthesis]]. Part of the book, on [[scenario planning]] and [[strategy maps]], is also available as a case study in the [[Harvard Business Review]] database.<ref>[http://hbr.org/product/scenario-based-strategy-maps/an/BH391-PDF-ENG Harvard Business Review case study]</ref> The fifth book, called "Socrates Reloaded" consists of a number of essays diving deeper into philosophical aspects of business and technology that started to emerge in "Dealing with Dilemmas".<ref>Socrates Reloaded, Buytendijk, F.A., 2012, Beingfrank, ISBN 1478316349</ref>
